website_summaries.verdict: These headrest hooks get the job done with a simple, easy to use design and hold an impressive amount of weight.
pros: Open sides easily hook onto headrest poles
Swivels from front to back without having to be removed
Each hook holds up to 18 lbs
cons: Might not fit properly on wide seats

customer_reviews.title: Worked just as I had hoped! No more front seat "bag dump"
customer_reviews.text: These hooks work great and function exactly the way I had hoped for! I actually turned them around and use them for the front of the seat, rather than the back. These hooks have solved the dreaded "bag dump" when you have to break suddenly. No more lunch spilling all over the inside of my work bag!! (For reference, I have a 2014 Ford Focus)
customer_reviews.author: KLGS

customer_reviews.title: Durable & perfect for my needs
customer_reviews.text: It’s been almost a year since I bought these and I’m still so glad I did. They fit nicely on the back of the headrests in my Subaru Forester. I use them to hang my reusable shopping bags so the bags have their own spot. I live in NY, so we get very hot temps in the summer and very cold in the winter, but they’re still in perfect condition. I definitely recommend these to anyone wanting help staying organized and keeping things neat in your car.
customer_reviews.author: MB

customer_reviews.title: Do the job, but not a perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: I got this so I could hang my purse on it. It does the job and holds my heavy purse. I really only needed one, but it came with 4- so I put a set in my car (4Runner) and a set in husbands truck (tundra). You can see from the pics, they don't exactly extend far enough to hang flat, but it's minimal and it does the job.
customer_reviews.author: L. G. Willis

customer_reviews.title: Easy, Simple, Sturdy, Can Fall Off Easy in certain scenarios
customer_reviews.text: Pretty simple and basic, which I like. Easy to place and remove. They come off easy when hit by rowdy kids or a tossed garment. They hold better when your head rest is in the lowest position, pushing on top of the hooks.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew P. Hale

customer_reviews.title: Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was hoping for! These hooks are great. They do not protrude out very far, are built solid and appear strong! They sit flush and snug under my headrest and do NOT wiggle about. These are not going to fall off at all! (however,that could depend on your car/headrest design) Takes only seconds to attach. I first bought a horrid, cheap product that was useless. I really liked the concept and was determined to find a functioning replacement that would actually work. I read the reviews carefully and I am so glad I choose this design. Simple, strong and stays in place! Price point is easy on the wallet. You too should be pleased.
customer_reviews.author: Helen

customer_reviews.title: Nifty Solution to an Annoying Problem
customer_reviews.text: These are designed to do one thing and they do that one thing very well. I am using them in two vehicles a Honda HR-V and a Volkswagen Jetta. They fit the headrest post in both and hang well and steady (unloaded) over the back of the front seats. The hook itself is large enough to hold a 2 inch shoulder strap from my gym bag and now it doesn't slide around on the back seat.
customer_reviews.author: Dale

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for securing purses and bags.
customer_reviews.text: Love these handy hooks. I always use it for my purse. A deer darted from the side of the road yesterday and I had to slam on my brakes. Luckily, my purse was hooked so it didn't go flying. I have one hanging on the back of the driver's seat to put my purse there when my husband is driving. It is totally out of the way and I can reach it easily. These hooks are also great for securing tote bags and shopping bags. They are sturdy plastic and so easy to install. Just hook the top part around the head rest post. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Lana G

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: I looked at a number of headrest hooks before selecting this one. I chose this because other reviewers mentioned how sturdy they are, and I can now attest to that as it held up my heavy bags with no problem. They are also designed so the hook does not fall off the headrest, and the headrest can be down and the hook still fits - which was a problem with other hooks that required the headrest to remain extended. I definitely recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia M. Terrell

customer_reviews.title: Will not recommend
customer_reviews.text: They are just pieces of plastic, one even broke while putting up on the back of the seat. They'll break easily under the load too. Will not recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Prasad B.

customer_reviews.title: Love these hooks
customer_reviews.text: I used to drive a siena minivan which had grocery hooks built in. When I traded in for a camry, it had no hooks, and I really missed them. These are a great substitute. The look nice against the gray leather interior, and fit well on headrest facing into the back seat. I keep my headrests down, which locks them into place. I would imagine, for someone taller, who must keep their headrests raised, they could move around if empty. I generally use cloth bags, and the handles are held securely by the hooks. Plastic bags also fit well onto the hooks. They are a sturdy plastic. An excellent, practical purchase to keep my car neat and organized again.
customer_reviews.author: Eema2Two

customer_reviews.title: Finally!
customer_reviews.text: I'm a woman that drives an F150 and there is no place for a purse (and I hate having my purse on the floor). Yes, I know, trucks aren't meant for purses, but I drive one and I've got a purse. These things install in like two seconds, fit perfectly, hold my purse just fine. Since I get four, I put all four on, and have used them for groceries (the smush-able stuff, like bread and eggs) and they work great. They will also come in very handy when camping season hits and we take the trailer on some road trips and the kids are in the back seat. It'll hold their stuff well.
customer_reviews.author: LunkTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Fall off easily
customer_reviews.text: They work just fine but if your a busy mom they aren’t worth the money. They easily fall off specially if they are bumped. If you don’t have a lot of hectic in your car though they work just fine. But I’ve lost 3 out of the 4. Probably under the seats
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works for my purse and other bags.
customer_reviews.text: These are much better than some flimsy metal ones I tried and threw away. These are a sturdy plastic; you can hang a lot from them. But they are light weight and a little springy so they sometimes pop off the headrest support bar. I wish there was a way to attach them firmly rather than just laying them down next to the bar. But if I'm careful, they do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Lee V P

customer_reviews.title: Not a fit....
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this did not fit our Audi headrests. Thought this would be an adjustable to fit any headrest. No place to return to!
customer_reviews.author: JKR

customer_reviews.title: Check fit
customer_reviews.text: These are well constructed and a good value. Unfortunately on my 2004 Acura MDX the headrest sits fairly far forward and these hooks are not wide enough to hang properly over then back of the seat.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Easy to install, strong enough, but not enough hook.
customer_reviews.text: They installed quickly and easily and stayed in place OK and are thick enough to hold a reasonable sized bag. But the hooks really don't curve up enough to reliably keep a cloth handled reusable shopping bag from sliding off, if a knee bumps them even a little, while getting into the backseat. They would also be improved with some sort of adjustable stabilizer bar you could install in between them (a stick and duct tape if you don't mind them being ugly). I'm not going to hold the movement against them because that was predictable but the fact that the hook doesn't go up enough to keep things from sliding off gets three stars.
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Service
customer_reviews.text: I gave this product 5 stars because of the service. This company sent me an email after my purchase. I replied to their email and there was an actual person that responded, yeah!! One of the hooks came broken in the package and they sent me a new package, even though I only needed one hook. The hooks work in my Sequoia better when faced to the back seat because of the length. They are a bit short to use in the front but still work as a purse hook without having to remove it every time someone rides in the front seat.
customer_reviews.author: Rohlo

customer_reviews.title: LOVE LOVE LOVE
customer_reviews.text: Keeps my daughters diaper bag up right so nothing spills out, Keeps my purse from spilling over or falling in the floor when i stop or turn. Fits fine facing forward, only complaint is that little bit too small to be faced backwards on my 4runner but still does its job. Will definitely recommend
customer_reviews.author: K. Mack

customer_reviews.title: Useful
customer_reviews.text: These were easy to install on my 2018 Hyundai Kona. I use them to keep my bags off the floor, to stop that annoying bag slide across the backseat when making turns, and to avoid the dreaded "bag dump" when making sudden stops. While these fit well in my car, I can see how they wouldn't fit a car that has larger-than-normal headrest posts or thicker seatbacks. They aren't adjustable in any way. You also do have to be careful when removing bags as they are easy to knock off. I am currently using 2 behind my driver's seat and plan to use 2 more hanging off the back seat into the cargo area for grocery bags, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Julie A.

customer_reviews.title: Talk about convenience!
customer_reviews.text: One of the things I hate is having my purse slide open and fall on the floor when I’m driving. I originally got these to hold my purse for car drives. It works like magic! And because it just hooks on the seat head rest it can be moved and many times as you want. I use the other ones on my back seats to face the trunk so I attach my grocery bags to it. It’s wonderful because I no longer have to worry about my grocery bags falling over and food rolling out of the bags.
customer_reviews.author: Curlmesweet

customer_reviews.title: Works on 2019 Yukon
customer_reviews.text: I didn't want the trash sitting in the car where it could be tipped. My minivan had the perfect indentation that protected it from being kicked over by the kids when they get in and out. Then we got a Yukon where the trash was ALWAYS getting spilled. These hooks work on all the headrests in the first / second rows (haven't tried the 3rd). I bought little trash bags that can hang. They are perfect, and the kids easily grab them on exit to keep trash out of the car. The hooks are not noticeable when a bag is not hanging.
customer_reviews.author: M. Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Buy it and be your whole self on your drive to work.
customer_reviews.text: Life saver. You don’t teally know how badly you need this until u install and use it. No more pocketbook contents on the floor with sudden stops! My passenger seat isn’t full of my work bag, lunch bag and laptop anymore. It makes me feel calm and put together without all that crap in my periphery on the drive in to work. I am not on-guard to protect anything from falling during the drive. Now, I can switch from TED talks to hardcore hip hop to The art of War (or Seduction) without my bags flying because I need to stop suddenly.
customer_reviews.author: Dinky Woodstock

customer_reviews.title: They hang around
customer_reviews.text: These hooks are so easy to install that they can be knocked off very easily when they are empty. I also noticed they aren't exactly useful if you use them to hang something with more than a short strap - my bags usually end up sitting on the back seat which keeps them from hanging without any slack. I do like these for their potential usefulness, but frustrated when used with anything with more than about an 4" long strap or handle, and if your seats are pushed back for long-legged drivers and/or passengers.
customer_reviews.author: kittybits

customer_reviews.title: Brilliant purse holder for the car
customer_reviews.text: Whoever dreamed these up totally gets how awkward it is to fish around behind your seat for your purse. Or have your purse and its contents tumble from the passenger seat. These are great for keeping your purse upright and in arm’s reach. I’ve even used them for takeout bags to make sure the food doesn’t topple over on the way home. I kept one and gave the other 3 away, and my friends think they’re amazing too. Crazy how a little piece of plastic can make life easier. 😉
customer_reviews.author: Juliet A. Martin

customer_reviews.title: Ofspower 4Pack Car Vehicle Back Seat Headrest...
customer_reviews.text: Have two each behind the two front seats. My husband and I keep jackets in the car, even in Hawaii, to use in restaurants, theaters, Costco's refrigerated section. We were piling them on the back seat and they would get wrinkled and buried. Now lightweight jackets are hanging neatly behind each seat. I even am able to put my purse on the hook over the jacket collar. Feels so much neater.
customer_reviews.author: RM

customer_reviews.title: Useful to hold your purse while driving with a passenger
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I usually put my purse in the passenger seat while driving, but when I have a passenger, I don't know where to put my purse. The hooks are really sturdy, made of metal, and clip on easily to your headrest in about 2 seconds. I installed 2 in my car (one on each seat so that my passenger could also hang a purse, or I could hang other bags). I previously purchased another brand in a different color for a different vehicle, and these metal hooks are better quality.
customer_reviews.author: Coffee Bean

customer_reviews.title: Hooks are too shallow.
customer_reviews.text: Just purchased these and they were easy to install and appear durable (don’t know that for a fact). The issue is that the hooks are too shallow for my purse handles, my wide strapped lunch tote or the handles on the lightweight duffle bag that I bring with me to work. In fact the only thing that may work on these hooks are the thin plastic bags from grocery stores, but I don’t think I’d be able to put multiple bags on any one hook as the bags may fall off. I am returning these and looking for others with deeper hooks.
customer_reviews.author: deejaytee

customer_reviews.title: Strong enough for a heavy backpack!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love these! I have two on the front passenger seat facing forward for my purse and lunch bag while I am driving to work, I have the other two facing backwards off the driver and passenger seats for the kids backpacks on the way to school. They are strong enough for a heavy bigger kids backpack, which I was unsure of. I am buying more for my husbands car as well as for my sisters and their kids. GREAT product!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Lupp

customer_reviews.title: These suckers works great!
customer_reviews.text: These are such a blessing. When my windows are down, it is nice to have my bag hidden and hanging on one of these hooks in the back. It is quite sturdy. When I have gone grocery shopping and do not need to use the trunk for light shopping, this comes in handy in keeping the bags out of the way. I would recommend it. Your headrest serves to help to keep them in place. So, if you like to have your headrest high because you are tall, this may not be a good fit for you.
customer_reviews.author: KAT

customer_reviews.title: Hooks A Great Idea, May or May Not Fit Your Vehicle
customer_reviews.text: This style hook is a great idea to keep plastic bags or re-usable shopping totes from spilling in the car or truck. I'd suggest buying these in person or at least accurately measuring your headrest posts and the real from them to the seat back. These hooks are rugged but they're an imperfect fit to both of my Toyotas though they're just right for my wife's Honda.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Koons

customer_reviews.title: Leaves friction lines!
customer_reviews.text: I do business from my car. I have to carry all of my materials with me. I'm always looking for ways to keep my car organized, hence the reason for this purchase. It does what it says it's supposed to do and initially I was very happy with the purchase until it was time to clean my car. I removed the hanger hooks and saw that it was leaving friction lines on the back of me leather seats where the plastic hook made contact with the leather. Not impressed. I immediately stopped using them. I'm not sure if it's too late to return these, but recommend not using these if your car has leather seats.
customer_reviews.author: Asi

customer_reviews.title: Nice idea, GREAT product
customer_reviews.text: I didn't know I needed or wanted something like this until I ran across it. Yes to both conditions. Normally I would toss something onto the floor or the back seat, or risk rolling around the trunk until I got home. These hangers are discrete, sturdy, and most of all, they work. Plastic bags, jackets, backpacks, quick runs to farmer's markets... this is my first place to hold things, considering weight and size of my haul. Definitely would recommend...
customer_reviews.author: Fuzzwatkins

customer_reviews.title: Not Helpful In The Least
customer_reviews.text: Bought these on an impulse, and wow, what a waste of money. Maybe it's just my car (Toyota Corolla), but these hooks hang too low to be of any use. Any bag or purse I hang there immediately falls over because the straps are too long. I tried using it for grocery bags, and every time I turned a corner stuff fell out of the bags and into the car. Waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: M Kim

customer_reviews.title: So Useful!
customer_reviews.text: I love these hooks! I have 3 in my car- one in the front passenger seat to hold my purse, and two in the back for groceries. No more purse spills or random fruit rolling around my trunk. Installation was very quick and easy. The bars that hold my headrests are rather thick, so I had to pull firmly on the hooks to set them in place. But, overall very easy. Highly recommend if you're tired of picking up the contents of your handbag or grocery bags!
customer_reviews.author: Lissa

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE these hook gadgets
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE these hook gadgets! They are so handy to place a few bags (either plastic shopping bags or fabric shopping bags) on these hooks to keep items from rolling around the vehicle. No more cautiously opening the tailgate of my SUV in fear of items rolling out (no more cleaning up a watermelon that rolled out when I opened the tailgate because I now know it will now be securely hanging in a bag from these hooks!). I am able to put 2 grocery bags on 1 hook (within reasonable weight). I am very happy with these hooks and highly recommend them!
customer_reviews.author: GDNRTVR

customer_reviews.title: Ingenius  hooks
customer_reviews.text: I absolutely love these hooks. I have ordered 4 sets and will probably be ordering more. They are one of the most functional products I have ever tried. I have one in my car and my husband's as well. I've also been giving them out to family and friends and they love it. The price is reasonable and these hooks are a practical solution to being able to reach my handbag while driving.
customer_reviews.author: NYSTYLE

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and just what I expected.
customer_reviews.text: OK I have put them in my car, but haven't had a chance to use them yet. My trip is coming up. I like everything about them. Thought they were metal, instead of plastic, but they are very sturdy. i"m sure they'll do the trick. My purse tips over and being able to either hang in in the passenger seat facing forward, or facing rear if someone is with me will be great. Plastic grocery bags will be easy to hang as well. :)
customer_reviews.author: GypsyBroker

customer_reviews.title: Very nifty
customer_reviews.text: I got these because my car doesn't have any hooks for coats/hangers and I'm always traveling. These hangers seem very sturdy for the price and took literally one second a piece to install and I have been using them every day since. For the few bucks, I think they are an excellent item. I would take a look at your headrest as the opening of this may be a little small for some vehicles. From the front of the headrest post to the back of your seat can be a maximum of about 6.5 cm (2.6 inches). This includes the diameter of the post of your headrest.
customer_reviews.author: Charlie

customer_reviews.title: I love these little things!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I rarely leave reviews but this are such neat things. I know it’s small and simple but I am not sure how I lived without them. LOL. It’s great quality. It looks great in my car. No more spilled purse on the front seat floor. When people are in the backseat their bag doesn’t have to sit on the floor. Everybody who sees it wants them. I keep a spare cross body purse hanging on a hanger behind my seat. I also hang my spare sweater in the back. No more dog hair on it. It’s also great to hang groceries on so there is more room in the back. Improve your life - buy this!!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Needs to be a little more flexible or tougher
customer_reviews.text: Really great idea and extremely useful. The only downfall is that I’ve already broken two out of the four pack in only 2 1/2 weeks. both of them have broken the exact same spot. I have a 40 ounce water bottle that I hang on it. Both times it broke, it happened on the corner. I’m assuming that the slight twisting action was enough to snap them. Still a great product. Maybe slight reinforcement would make this product exceptional.
customer_reviews.author: jason h.

customer_reviews.title: Light weight but sufficiently sturdy; smooth, not scratchy
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy hooks, with smooth milled edges, so no scratchy parts to scratch my upholstery or the head rest "legs". Perfect thing to keep a baseball cap handy for when driving into the sunset on the commute home. Great customer service too. I'm thinking these might be a good stocking stuffer for the guys on my Christmas list.
customer_reviews.author: NH girl at heart

customer_reviews.title: hook/hanger
customer_reviews.text: do what they are supposed to do. easy to install and hold grocery bags and my purses. i am happy i bought the pack, but now im realizing i dont need 4 so i will gift 2 to my sister or something, but it is priced well and im happy with my purchase so far. regarding durability i cant really say because i havent had it for say 3 months yet, but so far so good.
customer_reviews.author: H.

customer_reviews.title: So handy for hanging just about anything.
customer_reviews.text: There just isn't any room in the front seat area of my car where I can easily put my purse while I drive. I bought these for that purpose. I hang a hook on the passenger side headrest and hang my purse on it. It works perfectly, and I especially like that I can easily reach the phone in the outside pocket of my purse if necessary, and very easily grab my purse when I get to my destination. A great find.
customer_reviews.author: AZTransplant

customer_reviews.title: Love that my groceries no longer roll all over the ...
customer_reviews.text: Just got these and immediately put them to use. Love that my groceries no longer roll all over the back seat. Very easy to install, actually I installed a pair of them on my headrest properly and backwards on the back seat headrest (since I do not usually have back seat passengers) so I have 4 hooks easily accessible when I open the back door for multiple grocery bags. If and when I have a passenger, it will be so easy to simply turn the hooks around to their intended placement while I have a passenger then reverse them again.
customer_reviews.author: L. Justin

customer_reviews.title: Blends in & Works Great
customer_reviews.text: I'm very happy with the quality and thickness of these hooks. They don't look out of place and do a really good job of holding the many pounds of "essential" items that I carry in my purse at all times. I'm very pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: PinkyShopper

customer_reviews.title: Now that I have them, what do I use them for
customer_reviews.text: I thought these were a good idea, and for some, they may be. As for me, I can't find a use for them. They don't fit flat against the back of the seat on my 2019 Honda Passport, so anything hanging on them intrudes into the passenger's space. The headrest is the only place in the Passport that I've found were they can be attached. I don't have anything to hang there, so don't use them. They do seem to be sturdy, though.
customer_reviews.author: McGuy

customer_reviews.title: Works but easily knocked off
customer_reviews.text: Would have been fine if there was something to prevent hook getting knocked off the headrest which could happen taking your item off, bump in the road, or just brushing against it. Also, not quite long enough to hang over edge of my seat (Volt 2019) but still funcitonal.
customer_reviews.author: Jon

customer_reviews.title: Use these hook hangers ONLY for things that you WANT to fall off!
customer_reviews.text: I don’t get these hook hangers. It seems so simple, and such a great idea. But virtually everything falls off of the shallow hook. I’ve tried so hard to make these work that it’s now a running family joke!
customer_reviews.author: Why not?

customer_reviews.title: Game changer!!!
customer_reviews.text: Everyone needs this tiny gadget. Takes .2 seconds to install and suddenly there is a life changing purse hook in your car. No more hitting the curve at 64mph and dumping out the entire contents of aforementioned purse no more hitting the breaks suddenly and the purse sliding off the seat and landing upsidedown. We all know the magic of a purse and what will fit in there. I plan to order a set for everyone in my life. This thing is worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: S. L. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Too small for our over-ear headphones :(
customer_reviews.text: there is nothing wrong with these, but I bought them to hang up the kids headphones they use with out built in entertainment... and the hook is just a bit too small (shallow) to fit the headphones. I wouldn’t advise them for that purpose but for other stuff I guess they’re perfect.
customer_reviews.author: D'Anemone

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and great to have!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty clever idea! I love these so I don't have to bend after my back injury, to get my purse or bags off the floor of my car. It also keeps the groceries from sliding all over the backseat and from falling out the bags. Just very convenient and super easy put in and out if you ride with a friend or something and need to switch the vehicle it's in. I will order more for gifts for grandparents and friends.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: These work well. I put one in my car so I have a place to put my purse when my hubby rides with me. And I put one in his car for when he drives. I like that it keeps it off the floor (YUCK). I will say that my vehicle (13 Equinox), it only fits the back of the seat, as the front is too thick (some of the pictures show it holding bags upright in the front seat, doesn't work in my car). I was afraid it would rattle when empty, but it has a coating that keeps it quiet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great hooks!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these to put in my car for the kids to hang all their stuff on. It's important for me to keep things off the floor of the car, especially in the winter. My kids have been using it for their coats and face masks so far and they are working out great. Seem very thick and sturdy. Have not fallen off or broke with my kids getting in and out of the car.
customer_reviews.author: Laura M

customer_reviews.title: Fits perfectly on my car headrest
customer_reviews.text: These hooks were exactly what I was looking for. They fit perfectly on the headrest of my 2017 Kia Sorento and allows me to hang my purse, grocery bags, and jacket. Also got an email from the company to make sure everything was good with the order. Nice customer service and I would recommend to anyone
customer_reviews.author: Cake Lover

customer_reviews.title: Does the job
customer_reviews.text: I have an older Honda. I have no idea whether headrest supports are standardized in diameter, but it was a tight fit. I see where at least one person broke one getting it on and can understand it. That did not happen to me. If you are a fragile old lady, or just have the strength of one, find a helper to put it on; the bagger at the grocery perhaps. ;)
customer_reviews.author: E. Waldorph

customer_reviews.title: So Sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: These are so handy to have! I put them on every seat in my car. One on the passenger seat works great for my handbag, keeping it at my fingertips but not spilling over. I also use them on the back seats into the trunk and they are great for holding up the grocery bags. I have had my 20 pound briefcase on one and it holds through an hour of traffic with no signs of wear.
customer_reviews.author: Nina Foxenberg

customer_reviews.title: Not universal, does not fit every car.
customer_reviews.text: Bought a pack of 4 for our two cars. The hooks work/fit nicely on 2015 WRX. It however does not fit very well on our 2012 Murano. The Murano seats are thicker and the metal pole is also larger so we had to jam the hooks in. When you buy it, should look at dimension and make sure it fits thickness of your seat, to not make same mistake like me.
customer_reviews.author: Nikko

customer_reviews.title: Won’t stay on
customer_reviews.text: They will not stay on seats in either vehicle that I have. Every time I hang a bag on them they come off when taking bag out. Very frustrating!! Would not recommend. The hook doesn’t close ( open on 1side) this is why they will not stay put!!!
customer_reviews.author: camille brooks-brasher

customer_reviews.title: Does what it says!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for hanging my backpack so it doesn't get dirty on the floormats or roll around on the back seat. My backpack easily weighs 30 lb. with my MacBook Pro and all the accessories in it, and these headrest hooks show no sign of strain or bending. It's also ideal for holding plastic or cloth shopping bag behind the seat so nothing spills out of them. My seats are black leather, so the hooks look built-in and are hardly noticeable when not in use.
customer_reviews.author: Brett J. Belau

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for holding a pocket book or bags
customer_reviews.text: I got this to hang my small purse on. I have a small open purse and kept having the problem with it tipping over and spilling out the contents all over my seats. These work great! I have one on each headrest and no matter if I'm the passenger or driver, I have a place I can hang my purse and still be able to reach it from the front seat. They are also great for plastic grocery bags.
customer_reviews.author: MBR

customer_reviews.title: Great way to hold your bags/purses in the car
customer_reviews.text: I bought this so I can hang my purse on my seat, especially when I have someone riding in the passenger seat. They work well for the price - they might move around a bit if you don't have them secured with your headrest all the way down, and if you didn't have anything hanging on them, but I usually have them down anyway so it's not a problem. The weight of a bag hanging on them also would make them more secure. I liked that they were super easy to put on.
customer_reviews.author: Christine

customer_reviews.title: They fall off the headrest unless there is weight tugging it downward
customer_reviews.text: These hooks easily slip around the posts on your car headrest, but slip off easily if there isn’t enough weight pulling down on them. I had hoped they would just swivel and stay in place beneath the headrest, but the opening is a bit too large for it to stay in place. This product would be so much better if it had a carabiner clip to keep it from slipping off. Otherwise, this is a pretty nice product. Not ideal in my car.
customer_reviews.author: TBM

customer_reviews.title: Best style to keep your purse secure in the car!!
customer_reviews.text: I previously bought another style of these, but was frustrated as the other style barely poked out from under my headrest, making it quite a challenge to take my purse on/off of them. These are much easier to use! They hang down a few inches on the seat, so I can easily put my purse on the hooks. I really hate my purse spilling all over while I'm driving, so I'm happy to find this!!
customer_reviews.author: 🌟 Emma Elizabeth 🌟

customer_reviews.title: Comes in handy in an extended cab truck!
customer_reviews.text: I love these in my truck. Since I dont have a trunk it is great to have these to secure grocery bags from sliding all over the place in my truck. I have put a lot of weight on them and they have not broken or deformed. The only problem I have is that sometimes if I go over big bumps they will fall off the headrest posts onto the floor. If they made some kind of little catch to like on caribeaners to prevent them from falling off, they would be flawless.
customer_reviews.author: Bubs

customer_reviews.title: easy to attach to head rest
customer_reviews.text: I'm always looking for a place to put my purse when I'm the driver and I have a passenger. This solved that problem. You just lift your headrest a bit, hook these in, put your headrest back down and you have a very strong hook for holding anything. I live in a state that has a long winter and putting my purse on the floor in the backseat it would always get wet from the kids with snow on their feet. This prevents me from having to put my purse on the floor and I can get it out easily
customer_reviews.author: Joss

customer_reviews.title: They are plastic, not steel...but functional.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these items quickly without lots of research. They work just fine, but be careful because they are plastic and not steel made which makes them susceptible to easily failing if you put some muscle into them when trying to clip them into your seat poles. See attached picture. If you can avoid that, then they will work just fine without any major tugging.
customer_reviews.author: J Angel Bravo

customer_reviews.title: Convenient AF
customer_reviews.text: I have a tiny car and big purse, so when I have a passenger, I had nowhere to put my purse besides the backseat, but that was hard for me to reach easily. Then, I found this and I absolutely love it! I just reach behind the passenger seat and can access my purse or grocery bags.
customer_reviews.author: Cindy

customer_reviews.title: My poor purse has lived on the floorboard of my car ...
customer_reviews.text: Oh my gosh...where have these been all of my life?? My poor purse has lived on the floorboard of my car its whole life until I found these! Now it hangs behind my passenger seat! I love it! I use another one to hang a trash bag. I have one saved for back up and the 4th one I gave to my sister to save her purse!
customer_reviews.author: Dr. Montgomery

customer_reviews.title: Better options available...
customer_reviews.text: These are OK, but would be better if they were made of a more flexible plastic. As is, the hook sits stiffly, and you cannot lower the headrest to secure it, because then you jam it into the seat and as I have leather seats, I don’t want the product to scratch the leather over time. The hook part is also larger, and will come off if the headrest is not in the lowest position and you hurriedly take your purse/luch-bag or whatever you have hanging off the hook.
customer_reviews.author: Mom22Boys

customer_reviews.title: Hooks are small
customer_reviews.text: I love the idea of these but unfortunately the opening to place on the seat’s metal stakes is just not wide enough. Sure it clips on but it doesn’t allow it to be flush against the seat. It is durable though so that’s a plus. I usually hang my lunch bag on there and with coronavirus in full bloom in my state, I now hang my mask there too.
customer_reviews.author: Arual

customer_reviews.title: Good Enough for the price
customer_reviews.text: Needed hooks to hang my purse while driving and whatever additional shipping bags onto the back of my front seats. The hooks work great except they don’t fit on all rods of my headrest. I drive a 2016 Scion for reference. The hooks can only fit around the the rods that have divots to adjust the headrest. Each front seat has 2 rods connecting the headrest to the seat (like all cars do) but only 1 of the 2 rods has the divots for adjusting the headrest. With that being said, I can only use two hooks instead of the 4 as intended. It still works but a little disappointed they didn’t fit.
customer_reviews.author: A Spencer

customer_reviews.title: The hooks definitely help with keeping things off the floor ...
customer_reviews.text: The hooks definitely help with keeping things off the floor of my car. I bought my daughter in law a set as well. She has two girls who have book bags and lunch bags and I know they will really help her.
customer_reviews.author: Angela Joiner

customer_reviews.title: How did I live without these before?
customer_reviews.text: These were an impulse buy -- and they are worth every penny. They install super easily and have been great to hang my purse on, a bag for garbage, etc. They keep everything up and off the floor. Could you live without them? Yes. But, they are one of those little things that makes life a tad easier.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Love these hooks!
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these for several weeks now and I love them. I didn't know what I was missing. The installed effortlessly. They are ascetically pleasing and do not interfere with comfort at all. In my situation, they look like they came with the car. It's nice to be able to hold bags upright and not have them spilling all over the car. I with I had purchased sooner.
customer_reviews.author: MamaMouse3

customer_reviews.title: Why did I not know about these before
customer_reviews.text: Tired of your purse flying off your seat throwing its contents all over the floor of your car? I as so happy that I know have the very sturdy, easy to install car hooks in all of the family cars. My purse no longer hits the floor. I even hung a bag full of groceries on the hook this weekend. I would very highly recommend this affordable sturdy product.
customer_reviews.author: Linda Y

customer_reviews.title: Great for purses and delicate groceries
customer_reviews.text: I'm into designer purses and I don't like to put them on the car floor our out of reach in the back seat. These worked great in my car for me in that regard and especially for delicate grocery bags (eggs, apples, bread...) That I don't want sliding around the trunk or squished. I have 1 to my friend that does uber and he gets a lot of compliments on them so I gave 1 to my mom and she loves it.
customer_reviews.author: LJ

customer_reviews.title: Too long
customer_reviews.text: The product itself is really good except it's not the best option for small vehicles like my Honda civic. The hook is too long which causes for my bag to be in the way of my passengers. I don't have huge bags just a carry around everyday type if bag if that makes sense. Other than this I definitely recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Noemi

customer_reviews.title: Very useful but not for every sort of bag
customer_reviews.text: I do love these and am happy to have them, but the hook won't accommodate a large strap, so be aware of that. Otherwise I'm very happy that my smaller purses / a garbage bag or an umbrella can withstand those times when you have to stomp on the brakes and you're reminded of the fact that yes, the laws of gravity do actually apply to what is inside your vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny M. Raja

customer_reviews.title: Simple and functional!
customer_reviews.text: Hooks are not bulky at all. It is simple and functional. Fits great in 2017 Explorer. I purchased a different style that just kept getting in the way whenever kids got in and out of the car. These hooks sit right behind the head rest and out of the way. They can hook their water bottle and easily get to it when they need it. I'm thinking of getting more as gifts. Material seems very sturdy so far.
customer_reviews.author: Don

customer_reviews.title: These fit my Toyota Corolla car seats
customer_reviews.text: This hooks fit the seat back post and lay flat on the seat in my Toyota Corolla, where others haven't. I use one in the front to hang my purse on, and others in the back to secure my reusable grocery bags, and the trash bag. This keeps the car tidy and stuff isn't rolling on the floor. They also keep my purse secure and accessible for my keyless ignition. I would recommend these clips. The price is right and they have many uses.
customer_reviews.author: Karen Hartt

customer_reviews.title: Saved my mental health on a 40+ hour road trip.
customer_reviews.text: We’re great for the 40+ hours driving on our vacation. Easy to install and so useful. I bought two packs so had 8 total (for 10 people) everyone had a place to hang their backpacks or water bottles and fewer things were on the floor. I did not have to hear the continuous complaining from kids that they had dropped things that I have hear in the past. Easily supported the weight of my filled 64 oz steel water bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Nora

customer_reviews.title: Where have these been all my life
customer_reviews.text: These are such a great help! It's like having an extra pair of hands to keep bags together in the back seat. I seen a similar item on instagram for sell when I came here to look. Quality item. Great price
customer_reviews.author: R. Daniel

customer_reviews.title: I broke two trying install them.
customer_reviews.text: These didn't fit on my truck and I ended up breaking two of them trying to install them. The plastic doesn't flex enough to get around the headrest posts. Instead it snapped apart and shot pieces to the other side of the truck. Just imagine what would happen if you hung something on them that was too heavy!
customer_reviews.author: Mcubed07

customer_reviews.title: Unsure
customer_reviews.text: Can anybody tell me if them hooks they bought had two sharp triangular pieces on the inside of where it’s suppose to hook onto the headrest? (Check photo attached). Mine do and won’t allow me to fully hook these things onto my headrest and I’m worried that they’re just going to easily fall off when I go to take my purse off of it! Just bought them for my new car hoping to hang my bag and my stainless steel water bottle that does not fit in the cup holder, but I feel like they’re too loose. Will update after a few days of use!!
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Put on by the notches!!
customer_reviews.text: I put these on immediately after delivery, and broke one. They work well and are handy to have, especially in my husbands pickup. I didn’t put them on over the notches in the headrest poles, which made it even more difficult to install. One broke while trying to pull it on, but at least it was a pack of 3.
customer_reviews.author: AmandaF.

customer_reviews.title: good extra hooks for cars
customer_reviews.text: works better than expected, I was skeptical about buying plastic hooks for my truck to hold items but once they arrived and I got my hands on them all that went away. I drive a truck and they are do not sit perfectly on my seats because they are bigger than passenger cars but it doesnt seem to be a problem
customer_reviews.author: bigYUYO23

customer_reviews.title: Love them
customer_reviews.text: I love this! So easy to take on and off. I mainly use it to hang my water bottle on. I have a large hydro flask and there's no good spot in my car for it to sit since it's so large. Also very convenient for a small bag or a bag you don't want rolling around in the back seat. They are also very discrete. My interior is black and these blend right in. I love the minimal design. I would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Justina

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I use it on my car passenger head rest to hold my purse. I got so tired of turning the car and my purse would fall over on the floor on the contents would fall out between the seat and the door. WORKS GREAT for my purpose! We also used it for Dry Cleaning pick-up and groceries. Thank goodness it is removeable for any seat in the car.
customer_reviews.author: Shari J.

customer_reviews.title: Not bad
customer_reviews.text: These car clips are great for holding your purse or gym bag but you do need to be careful about not putting heavy items on these cause yes it will hold but it will look like it’s about to pop off the head rest! I honestly use this for my door dashing and grub hub delivery and love it so my seats don’t smell and it keeps the food from rolling while turning!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not quite
customer_reviews.text: These would be great if they fit on my headrests. They are very heavy duty plastic so that's nice but their shape doesn't allow them to rest properly on the seat. Hook opening is also too narrow for the metal bars in my headrest. I drive a Tahoe for reference.
customer_reviews.author: Holden & Greys Mama

customer_reviews.title: No longer searching for my purse.
customer_reviews.text: I needed something to keep my purse off the floor and from flying off the seat and on to the floor if I had to stop too quickly. These little hooks work perfectly. My purse can get quite heavy, so it's sturdy and gone are the days of not being able to reach my purse. I would definitely buy these again.
customer_reviews.author: CoolLady

customer_reviews.title: This is a really good addition to my car
customer_reviews.text: Bought it for my wife to hand her purse. Every time we enter the car, There is always a problem where to keep the purse. When she is alone she puts it on the shot-gun seat, but when I am there, I have to find a place for it.. Now we can just hang it behind the shot-gun seat. It's accessible , and convenient...
customer_reviews.author: Vinay R. Desai

customer_reviews.title: Would not buy again
customer_reviews.text: These fall off too easily and end up on the floor. Pretty much going to throw them away. Maybe they work better for certain cars than others.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn C

customer_reviews.title: Great product, I will buy more.
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. I put them in the car yesterday and I like them. I will be buying more to put some more in the back of the car. I needed to get something, because my oldest child likes to ride up front, so I had no where to put my purse. My purse hasn't fallen off and the hooks seem deep enough to hold it.
customer_reviews.author: Shay Brydie

customer_reviews.title: Just bought a second pack
customer_reviews.text: I love these things I’ve been handing them out to friends and finding new places in my house to use them. I’ve gone through two packs of them so far they’re really great to hang my masks in my car my hats etc. they’ve come in more handy than I ever thought they would highly recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: lisa

customer_reviews.title: So glad these were only $5!
customer_reviews.text: These hooks didn't fit around the headrest AT ALL! I snapped one trying to apply it. They are made of brittle plastic and are not flexible to be able to property fit on the headrest. I tried in three different cars and couldn't get them to fit in any of them. Thank goodness they were only $5 because I can't return them since one broke!
customer_reviews.author: Tari Ross

customer_reviews.title: I have actually used them many times
customer_reviews.text: I was sceptical when I saw these but now I need to order more for my other vehicles. They are just plastic hooks but their bent fashion make them fit perfect. My wife hangs her purse on every day. I have 4 in my car and when she brings groceries home all 4 hooks have bags hanging. None have broken yet
customer_reviews.author: JLSmith

customer_reviews.title: These are plastic
customer_reviews.text: I really like the hooks but I did not clearly read the description so I was not expecting them to be plastic. The hooks work great but they do not stay on the back of the headrest since they are so light. If I had to buy again I would look for something a little heavier so I am not always picking them up off the floor.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I like these a lot, and they're great for keeping your car neat and organized. I recently went on a family vacation, and the car was packed to the brim. We used these in the back seat to keep things from being piled around our feet which was nice. My only problem with them is that when there's nothing hanging on them, they fall off very easily when bumped. I wish they clipped on somehow instead of just hooking on to the headrest.
customer_reviews.author: Emily A.

customer_reviews.title: Lifesavers!
customer_reviews.text: These are a must buy for anyone! They are perfect for groceries, purses, hanging clothes, anything you need to be upright or not on your seat! I bought a new car and was so worried about things spilling over in my backseat or my hatch so you can really use these in both scenarios. If you have a hatchback then I really recommend turning the hooks around on your backseat and using them to hang things like luggage in the hatch so that there is more room on the floor of the hatch for more items!
customer_reviews.author: Haley Kemp

product_meta.title: EldHus Ofspower 4-Pack Car Vehicle Back Seat Headrest Hook Hanger Storage for Purse Groceries Bag Handbag
product_meta.description: Of power 4Pack Car Back Seat Hanger Hook Are you often trouble with no space to put the groceries while on the car? This universal car back seat hook is specially designed to hang groceries, clothes, umbrella, handbags, water bottles, kid's toys, baby supplies and much more. to get coupon, the best interior car accessories car organizer hooks Converts your car's headrest into a convenient storage space to hang groceries, clothes, umbrella, handbags, water bottles, kid's toys, baby supplies and much more Organizes back seat clutter and opens up seat, floor and leg room. Swing hook around to either the front or back of the seat to use as desired Keeps shopping bags from rolling around the floor, spilling their contents. Eliminates blocked vision caused by hanging clothing in rearview window Upgraded side opening design for easy and fast installation, no need to disassemble the headrest. Hold up to 18 lb./per hook Contains 4 hooks. Rotatable design and can be hidden when not use. High-quality ABS and silicon rubber made, durable and environmental
feature_bullets: Organizes effectively : Turn wasted space into storage space for groceries, handbags, grocery bags, purses, schoolbags, umbrellas, water bottles, shopping bags and more
Special half open design : Allows you to install these hooks easily, no need to take off the headrests, you can freely set or remove the hooks in secs without extra tools, quick and convenient.
Grade ABS material : Make it bearing 44lb/per hook, deal with most of your belongings in your car.
